content.description: On the main face of the boulder locate the enormous inset wedge that has an upper and lower seam running lengthwise across the boulder.  At the mid-left side of this long feature (4ft right of the end of the feature) find the match-able undercling section. Stand start with underclings and reach the top crack/seam. Venture directly above into the slabby void, negotiating past thin knobs to the blank top.
content.location: On the main face of the boulder locate the enormous inset wedge that has an upper and lower seam running lengthwise across the boulder.  At the mid-left side of this long feature.

content.description:
On the main face of the boulder locate the enormous inset wedge that has an upper and lower seam running lengthwise across the boulder. To the right side of the feature near the pointed end, find the large, match-able juggy undercling section. Stand start matched in the undercling and climb direct up past the upper crack to the blank slab face above. 

 Negotiate tiny knobs past the slabby terrain to the rounded top.
content.location: On the main face of the boulder locate the enormous inset wedge that has an upper and lower seam running lengthwise across the boulder. To the right side of the feature.

content.description: Directly below and almost touching the Hunted Boulder. The Dome Block has a super slabby, rounded, dome-like top that is mostly devoid of features aside from a few scattered, small knobs. As an answer to a land full of powerful steep crimping, this unusual-for-GHSP type of feature is fun to climb if you are looking for thin, technical slabbing.
